info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 9:18PM EDT until August 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southern Fayette County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Northern Preston County in northeastern West Virginia... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 918 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Cassville, or 9 miles southeast of Waynesburg, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Westover, Kingwood, Star City, Farmington, Fairdale, Point Marion, Granville, Brookhaven, Cassville, Fairchance, Smithfield, Reedsville, Masontown, Bobtown, Nemacolin, Tunnelton, Greensboro, Blacksville, and Brandonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 29. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 144 and 160. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
